qas.question: Once the German populations was removed, what three groups  settled into the nothern area?
In the Soviet section to the north, what did they want to expel from their land?

answers.text: eliminating all remnants of German history

qas.question: What else happened in the northern part of East Prussia in the now Russian area?

answers.text: names were replaced by new Russian names

qas.question: In what year was the military zone created?
In what year did Leonid Brezhnev come to power?
In what year did Russia star settling ethnic Russians in the northern part?
In what year was the new "House of the Soviets" completed?

context: After the expulsion of the German population <a0_0>ethnic Russians, Belarusians, and Ukrainians<a0_0/> were settled in the northern part. In the Soviet part of the region, a policy of <a1_0>eliminating all remnants of German history<a1_0/> was pursued. All German place <a2_0>names were replaced by new Russian names<a2_0/>. The exclave was a military zone, which was closed to foreigners; Soviet citizens could only enter with special permission. In <b3_0><b4_0><b5_0><b6_0>1967<b6_0/><b5_0/><b4_0/><b3_0/> the remnants of Königsberg Castle were demolished on the orders of Leonid Brezhnev to make way for a new "House of the Soviets".
